Intervention: Patients receive 41.25 mg/m2 of doxorubicin IV over 24 hours on days -9 to -6, 100 mg/kg of cyclophosphamide IV over 2 hours on day -5, and 725 mg/m2 of paclitaxel IV over 24 hours on day -4. PBSC are reinfused on days -2 and 0. G-CSF at 5 ug/kg IV is administered beginning on day 0 and continuing until blood counts recover.
peripheral blood stem cell transplantation: Patients receive autologous peripheral blood stem cells

Patients receive cyclophosphamide 1.5 g/m2/day IV, carboplatin 200 mg/m2/day IV, and thiotepa 125 mg/m2/day IV over 24 hours on days -7 to -4. PBSC are reinfused on day -2 and 0 and G-CSF at 5ug/kg IV is administered as in arm I.
peripheral blood stem cell transplantation: Patients receive autologous peripheral blood stem cells
Eligibility: Histologically proven high-risk primary breast cancer with less than 60% chance of progression-free survival of 3 years from diagnosis
Stage II with at least 10 positive axillary nodes OR
No histologically proven bone marrow metastasis
SGOT or SGPT no greater than 2 times upper limit of normal
Ejection fraction at least 55% by MUGA
No prior significant valvular heart disease or arrhythmia
pO_2 at least 85 mm Hg on room air
pCO_2 at least 43 mm Hg on room air
DLCO at least 60% lower limit of predicted
No other prior malignancy except squamous cell or basal cell skin cancer or stage I or carcinoma in situ of the cervix
No CNS dysfunction that would preclude compliance
No sensitivity to E. coli-derived products
Fertile patients must use effective contraception
At least 4 weeks since prior chemotherapy
No prior doxorubicin of total dose exceeding 240 mg/m^2
No prior paclitaxel of total dose of at least 750 mg/m^2
No more than 12 months since prior conventional-dose adjuvant chemotherapy
At least 4 weeks since prior hormonal therapy
At least 4 weeks since prior radiotherapy
No prior radiation to the left chest wall
Results: RFS events included death or disease recurrence. Patients who did not experience disease recurrence or death were censored at the date of last follow-up. Survival rates were estimates using the Kaplan-Meier method.

Arm/Group Description: Patients receive 41.25 mg/m2 of doxorubicin IV over 24 hours on days -9 to -6, 100 mg/kg of cyclophosphamide IV over 2 hours on day -5, and 725 mg/m2 of paclitaxel IV over 24 hours on day -4. PBSC are reinfused on days -2 and 0. G-CSF at 5 ug/kg IV is administered beginning on day 0 and continuing until blood counts recover.
peripheral blood stem cell transplantation: Patients receive autologous peripheral blood stem cells
Unit of Measure: percentage of participants  47        (24 to 67)

Arm/Group Description: Patients receive cyclophosphamide 1.5 g/m2/day IV, carboplatin 200 mg/m2/day IV, and thiotepa 125 mg/m2/day IV over 24 hours on days -7 to -4. PBSC are reinfused on day -2 and 0 and G-CSF at 5ug/kg IV is administered as in arm I.
peripheral blood stem cell transplantation: Patients receive autologous peripheral blood stem cells
Unit of Measure: percentage of participants  55        (41 to 68)
